      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }

  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

 }
 }

  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically

    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;

    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The fucntion `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` calls `PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetData` to request some auth data from CloudAP at line [1]. The NavigationRequest may be deferred until the callback `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback` calls `Resume`. However, calling `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [2].<span class="line"><!---->The fucntion `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` calls `PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetData` to request some auth data from CloudAP at line [1]. The NavigationRequest may be deferred until the callback `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback` calls `Resume`. However, calling `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [2].<!----></span><br><br>There are several ways to let `Resume` delete the NavigationRequest synchronously. For example, if we do a cross-site prerendering, the PrerenderNavigationThrottle would cancel the navigation.<span class="line"><!---->There are several ways to let `Resume` delete the NavigationRequest synchronously. For example, if we do a cross-site prerendering, the PrerenderNavigationThrottle would cancel the navigation.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>content::NavigationThrottle::ThrottleCheckResult<span class="line"><!---->content::NavigationThrottle::ThrottleCheckResult<!----></span><br>PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders() {<span class="line"><!---->PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders() {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetInstance().GetData(  // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->  PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetInstance().GetData(  // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>      navigation_handle()->GetURL(),<span class="line"><!---->      navigation_handle()-&gt;GetURL(),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback,<!----></span><br>                     weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->                     weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  is_deferred_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  is_deferred_ = true;<!----></span><br>  return content::NavigationThrottle::DEFER;<span class="line"><!---->  return content::NavigationThrottle::DEFER;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback(<span class="line"><!---->void PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback(<!----></span><br>    net::HttpRequestHeaders auth_headers) {<span class="line"><!---->    net::HttpRequestHeaders auth_headers) {<!----></span><br>  net::HttpRequestHeaders::Iterator it(auth_headers);<span class="line"><!---->  net::HttpRequestHeaders::Iterator it(auth_headers);<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  // Resume the deferred request.<span class="line"><!---->  // Resume the deferred request.<!----></span><br>  if (is_deferred_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (is_deferred_) {<!----></span><br>    Resume();<span class="line"><!---->    Resume();<!----></span><br>    is_deferred_ = false;  // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->    is_deferred_ = false;  // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  fetch_headers_callback_ran_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  fetch_headers_callback_ran_ = true;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=69;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=69;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=69;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=95;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=95;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=95;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 112.0.5593.1 asan buid<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 112.0.5593.1 asan buid<!----></span><br>Operating System: Chrome on Windows only<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Chrome on Windows only<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Apply the attached path.diff, this is to simulate Azure AD SSO for Chromium, for the convenience of reproduction in the local asan environment<span class="line"><!---->1. Apply the attached path.diff, this is to simulate Azure AD SSO for Chromium, for the convenience of reproduction in the local asan environment<!----></span><br>2. Host poc.html at localhost:8000 using nodejs<span class="line"><!---->2. Host poc.html at localhost:8000 using nodejs<!----></span><br>node .\server.js<span class="line"><!---->node .\server.js<!----></span><br>3. Run<span class="line"><!---->3. Run<!----></span><br>out\asan\chrome.exe --enable-features=CloudApAuth <span class="line"><!---->out\asan\chrome.exe --enable-features=CloudApAuth <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br>*Fix Suggestion*<span class="line"><!---->*Fix Suggestion*<!----></span><br>Since `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, we can reorder `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` to make sure no code would run after `Resume`<span class="line"><!---->Since `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, we can reorder `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` to make sure no code would run after `Resume`<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc b/chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc b/chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc<!----></span><br>index 7d3e6f41f3356..3f69c5354212b 100644<span class="line"><!---->index 7d3e6f41f3356..3f69c5354212b 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -89,12 +89,12 @@ void PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback(<span class="line"><!---->@@ -89,12 +89,12 @@ void PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback(<!----></span><br>     navigation_handle()->SetRequestHeader(it.name(), it.value());<span class="line"><!---->     navigation_handle()-&gt;SetRequestHeader(it.name(), it.value());<!----></span><br>   }<span class="line"><!---->   }<!----></span><br><br>+  fetch_headers_callback_ran_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->+  fetch_headers_callback_ran_ = true;<!----></span><br>   // Resume the deferred request.<span class="line"><!---->   // Resume the deferred request.<!----></span><br>   if (is_deferred_) {<span class="line"><!---->   if (is_deferred_) {<!----></span><br>-    Resume();<span class="line"><!---->-    Resume();<!----></span><br>     is_deferred_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->     is_deferred_ = false;<!----></span><br>+    Resume();<span class="line"><!---->+    Resume();<!----></span><br>   }<span class="line"><!---->   }<!----></span><br>-  fetch_headers_callback_ran_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->-  fetch_headers_callback_ran_ = true;<!----></span><br> }<span class="line"><!----> }<!----></span><br><br> }  // namespace enterprise_auth<span class="line"><!----> }  // namespace enterprise_auth<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan.log<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan.log<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>Comment 2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->Comment 2<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br>1. SG, I'll work on a fix. Thanks jtrrodant@ for the great write-up!<span class="line"><!---->1. SG, I'll work on a fix. Thanks jtrrodant@ for the great write-up!<!----></span><br><br>2. The patch diff is reasonable but not realistic. The feature is only enabled for certain hard-coded URLs (currently only<span class="line"><!---->2. The patch diff is reasonable but not realistic. The feature is only enabled for certain hard-coded URLs (currently only<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>login.live.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://login.live.com"><!---->login.live.com<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>login.microsoftonline.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://login.microsoftonline.com"><!---->login.microsoftonline.com<!----></a>) and the patch diff changes the list of supported URLs which is not possible in practice. Is there a way to reproduce the issue with the supported URLs?<span class="line"><!---->) and the patch diff changes the list of supported URLs which is not possible in practice. Is there a way to reproduce the issue with the supported URLs?<!----></span><br><br><br>Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>Comment 4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c4"><!---->Comment 4<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br>The code path does not exist in M110.<span class="line"><!---->The code path does not exist in M110.<!----></span><br><br>Although the feature is implemented in M110, it is behind both a feature flag and a default-disabled policy (CloudAPAuthEnabled), and support for the policy begins in M111. It's possible to reach the code path in M110, but the user would have to enable the policy and add it to the "EnableExperimentalPolicies" policy: <span class="line"><!---->Although the feature is implemented in M110, it is behind both a feature flag and a default-disabled policy (CloudAPAuthEnabled), and support for the policy begins in M111. It's possible to reach the code path in M110, but the user would have to enable the policy and add it to the "EnableExperimentalPolicies" policy: <!----></span>https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies"><!---->https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies<!----></a><br><br>Once the feature launches in M111, it will still be gated by the default-disabled CloudAPAuthEnabled. Users that don't enable the policy will never come across the code path.<span class="line"><!---->Once the feature launches in M111, it will still be gated by the default-disabled CloudAPAuthEnabled. Users that don't enable the policy will never come across the code path.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

<span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f19d038a9cb7c37653a7fa79f6060359a1ddcb56<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Feb 20 16:27:26 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Feb 20 16:27:26 2023<!----></span><br><br>[CloudAP SSO] Move navigation throttle Resume() to end of method.<span class="line"><!---->[CloudAP SSO] Move navigation throttle Resume() to end of method.<!----></span><br><br>Resume() can synchronously delete the corresponding navigation throttle,<span class="line"><!---->Resume() can synchronously delete the corresponding navigation throttle,<!----></span><br>so nothing after it should reference the throttle.<span end of method.<span class="line"><!---->[CloudAP SSO] Move navigation throttle Resume() to end of method.<!----></span><br><br>Resume() can synchronously delete the corresponding navigation throttle,<span class="line"><!---->Resume() can synchronously delete the corresponding navigation throttle,<!----></span><br>so nothing after it should reference the throttle.<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations Rong! Upon further assessment we've decided to extend the RCE renderer bonus for this issue since a compromised renderer was not required to trigger this UAF in the browser process. Thanks again for your efforts in discovering and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations Rong! Upon further assessment we've decided to extend the RCE renderer bonus for this issue since a compromised renderer was not required to trigger this UAF in the browser process. Thanks again for your efforts in discovering and reporting this issue to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        for LitElement.

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1417122%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D800" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1417122%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D800%252526ust%25253D1703399906046209%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw1EK_6yV52VgsMYxe0fIktt%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <h1>

      jtrro...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->jtrro...@gmail.com<!----></span>

        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Feb 17, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Feb 17, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Feb 17, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Feb 17, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The fucntion `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` calls `PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetData` to request some auth data from CloudAP at line [1]. The NavigationRequest may be deferred until the callback `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback` calls `Resume`. However, calling `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [2].<span class="line"><!---->The fucntion `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` calls `PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetData` to request some auth data from CloudAP at line [1]. The NavigationRequest may be deferred until the callback `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback` calls `Resume`. However, calling `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [2].<!----></span><br><br>There are several ways to let `Resume` delete the NavigationRequest synchronously. For example, if we do a cross-site prerendering, the PrerenderNavigationThrottle would cancel the navigation.<span class="line"><!---->There are several ways to let `Resume` delete the NavigationRequest synchronously. For example, if we do a cross-site prerendering, the PrerenderNavigationThrottle would cancel the navigation.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>content::NavigationThrottle::ThrottleCheckResult<span class="line"><!---->content::NavigationThrottle::ThrottleCheckResult<!----></span><br>PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders() {<span class="line"><!---->PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders() {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetInstance().GetData(  // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->  PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetInstance().GetData(  // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>      navigation_handle()->GetURL(),<span class="line"><!---->      navigation_handle()-&gt;GetURL(),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback,<!----></span><br>                     weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->                     weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  is_deferred_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  is_deferred_ = true;<!----></span><br>  return content::NavigationThrottle::DEFER;<span class="line"><!---->  return content::NavigationThrottle::DEFER;<!----></span><br>}<span         Tentatively setting the FoundIn to M110 based on the suspected CL[1] having been added in M110. igorruvinov@ -- please say so if the code path is actually only possible in M111 or M112. Note that whether or not the feature is enabled on a certain channel is irrelevant for the FoundIn label, only whether the code path exists.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting the FoundIn to M110 based on the suspected CL[1] having been added in M110. igorruvinov@ -- please say so if the code path is actually only possible in M111 or M112. The patch diff is reasonable but not realistic. The feature is only enabled for certain hard-coded URLs (currently only<span class="line"><!---->2. The patch diff is reasonable but not realistic. The feature is only enabled for certain hard-coded URLs (currently only<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>login.live.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://login.live.com"><!---->login.live.com<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>login.microsoftonline.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://login.microsoftonline.com"><!---->login.microsoftonline.com<!----></a>) and the patch diff changes the list of supported URLs which is not possible in practice. Is there a way to reproduce the issue with the supported URLs?<span class="line"><!---->) and the patch diff changes the list of supported URLs which is not possible in practice. Is there a way to reproduce the issue with the supported URLs?<!----></span><br><br><br>Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>Comment 4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c4"><!---->Comment 4<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br>The code path does not exist in M110.<span class="line"><!---->The code path does not exist in M110.<!----></span><br><br>Although the feature is implemented in M110, it is behind both a feature flag and a default-disabled policy (CloudAPAuthEnabled), and support for the policy begins in M111. It's possible to reach the code path in M110, but the user would have to enable the policy and add it to the "EnableExperimentalPolicies" policy: <span class="line"><!---->Although the feature is implemented in M110, it is behind both a feature flag and a default-disabled policy (CloudAPAuthEnabled), and support for the policy begins in M111. It's possible to reach the code path in M110, but the user would have to enable the policy and add it to the "EnableExperimentalPolicies" policy: <!----></span>https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies"><!---->https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies<!----></a><br><br>Once the feature launches in M111, it will still be gated by the default-disabled CloudAPAuthEnabled. Users that don't enable the policy will never come across the code path.<span class="line"><!---->Once the feature launches in M111, it will still be gated by the default-disabled CloudAPAuthEnabled. Users that don't enable the policy will never come across the code path.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Requesting merge to beta M111 because latest trunk commit (1107483) appears to be after beta branch point (1097615).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to beta M111 because latest trunk commit (1107483) appears to be after beta branch point (1097615).<!----></span><br><br>Merge review required: M111 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M111 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you for fixing this security bug! We aim to ship security fixes as quickly as possible, to limit their opportunity for exploitation as an "n-day" (that is, a bug where git fixes are developed into attacks before those fixes reach users).<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for fixing this security bug! We aim to ship security fixes as quickly as possible, to limit their opportunity for exploitation as an "n-day" (that is, a bug where git fixes are developed into attacks before those fixes reach users).<!----></span><br><br>Sheriffbot has determined this fix is necessary on milestone(s): [111].<span class="line"><!---->Sheriffbot has determined this fix is necessary on milestone(s): [111].<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<!----></span><br>1.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          flex-shrink: 0;

          max-width: 1000px;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

        mr-issue-metadata {

          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

        mr-launch-overview {

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The fucntion `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` calls `PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetData` to request some auth data from CloudAP at line [1]. The NavigationRequest may be deferred until the callback `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback` calls `Resume`. However, calling `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [2].<span class="line"><!---->The fucntion `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` calls `PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetData` to request some auth data from CloudAP at line [1]. The NavigationRequest may be deferred until the callback `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback` calls `Resume`. However, calling `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [2].<!----></span><br><br>There are several ways to let `Resume` delete the NavigationRequest synchronously. For example, if we do a cross-site prerendering, the PrerenderNavigationThrottle would cancel the navigation.<span class="line"><!---->There are several ways to let `Resume` delete the NavigationRequest synchronously. For example, if we do a cross-site prerendering, the PrerenderNavigationThrottle would cancel the navigation.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>content::NavigationThrottle::ThrottleCheckResult<span class="line"><!---->content::NavigationThrottle::ThrottleCheckResult<!----></span><br>PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders() {<span class="line"><!---->PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders() {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetInstance().GetData(  // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->  PlatformAuthProviderManager::GetInstance().GetData(  // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>      navigation_handle()->GetURL(),<span class="line"><!---->      navigation_handle()-&gt;GetURL(),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback,<!----></span><br>                     weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->                     weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  is_deferred_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  is_deferred_ = true;<!----></span><br>  return content::NavigationThrottle::DEFER;<span class="line"><!---->  return content::NavigationThrottle::DEFER;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback(<span class="line"><!---->void PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback(<!----></span><br>    net::HttpRequestHeaders auth_headers) {<span class="line"><!---->    net::HttpRequestHeaders auth_headers) {<!----></span><br>  net::HttpRequestHeaders::Iterator it(auth_headers);<span class="line"><!---->  net::HttpRequestHeaders::Iterator it(auth_headers);<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  // Resume the deferred request.<span class="line"><!---->  // Resume the deferred request.<!----></span><br>  if (is_deferred_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (is_deferred_) {<!----></span><br>    Resume();<span class="line"><!---->    Resume();<!----></span><br>    is_deferred_ = false;  // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->    is_deferred_ = false;  // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  fetch_headers_callback_ran_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  fetch_headers_callback_ran_ = true;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=69;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=69;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=69;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=95;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=95;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/enterprise/platform_auth/platform_auth_navigation_throttle.cc;l=95;drc=201b30c56179ff5e6f4c915ec69b19c62e8951d2<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 112.0.5593.1 asan buid<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 112.0.5593.1 asan buid<!----></span><br>Operating System: Chrome on Windows only<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Chrome on Windows only<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Apply the attached path.diff, this is to simulate Azure AD SSO for Chromium, for the convenience of reproduction in the local asan environment<span class="line"><!---->1. Apply the attached path.diff, this is to simulate Azure AD SSO for Chromium, for the convenience of reproduction in the local asan environment<!----></span><br>2. Host poc.html at localhost:8000 using nodejs<span class="line"><!---->2. `Resume`<span class="line"><!---->Since `Resume` may delete PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle synchronously, we can reorder `PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeaders` to make sure no code would run Is there a way to reproduce the issue with the supported URLs?<!----></span><br><br><br>Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>Comment 4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c4"><!---->Comment 4<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br>The code path does not exist in M110.<span class="line"><!---->The code path does not exist in M110.<!----></span><br><br>Although the feature is implemented in M110, it is behind both a feature flag and a default-disabled policy (CloudAPAuthEnabled), and support for the policy begins in M111. It's possible to reach the code path in M110, but the user would have to enable the policy and add it to the "EnableExperimentalPolicies" policy: <span class="line"><!---->Although the feature is implemented in M110, it is behind both a feature flag and a default-disabled policy (CloudAPAuthEnabled), and support for the policy begins in M111. It's possible to reach the code path in M110, but the user would have to enable the policy and add it to the "EnableExperimentalPolicies" policy: <!----></span>https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies"><!---->https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#EnableExperimentalPolicies<!----></a><br><br>Once the feature launches in M111, it will still be gated by the default-disabled CloudAPAuthEnabled. Users that don't enable the policy will never come across the code path.<span class="line"><!---->Once the feature launches in M111, it will still be gated by the default-disabled CloudAPAuthEnabled. Users that don't enable the policy will never come across the code path.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
